definitions.definition: To rewrite existing source code in order to improve its readability , reusability or structure without affecting its meaning or behaviour .
examples: The code works, but I must refactor it before it is production quality.

definitions.definition: To rewrite existing text in order to improve its readability , reusability or structure without intentionally affecting its meaning . Similar to, but sometimes involving more extensive restructuring than, copy editing .
examples: Two significant activities which to contribute to community projects, such as Wikipedia, are to refactor complicated articles into simpler ones, and to refactor duplicated content into reusable templates.

main_definition: ( programming ) To rewrite existing source code in order to improve its readability , reusability or structure without affecting its meaning or behaviour .
secondary_definitions: ( writing ) To rewrite existing text in order to improve its readability , reusability or structure without intentionally affecting its meaning . Similar to, but sometimes involving more extensive restructuring than, copy editing .
